name: Rio Ponte di Muro
description:
Very short trip with a nice enclosed part under a rock bridge

Approach

From the bridge follow the marked trail into the valley. After the path crosses the canyon via a rock bridge, follow the path into the woods and cross into the creekbed below the dam.

Descent

  • C 25m: bolt (L)
  • D W to the rock bridge (escape possible on the left)
  • C 15m: bolt (R)
  • J 1m
  • C 5m: bolt (L)
  • C 20m: bolt (L), dry rappel which bypasses the narrow part

or

  • C 8m: bolt(L)
  • C 6m: bolt(R) in the narrow part
  • D W
  • C 8m: bolt (L)
  • C 12m: bolt (L)
  • D W 200m

C = cascate D = down climb J= jump T=tobbogan (slide) W= walking L = left R = right

Exit

Exit the canyon near the bridge on either side of the creek

Red tape

Trip reports and media
